title: Insurance Product Life Cycle Management for Life & Annuity
summary: The article discusses how insurance agencies should adapt their offerings to meet the evolving needs of their customers. It emphasizes the need for agencies to recognize the differing priorities of clients at different stages of life, such as young families focused on affordability and coverage versus retirees concerned with tax advantages and estate planning.  This ensures that the agency can provide relevant and timely solutions, preventing customer churn as their insurance needs change.

title: The Importance of Income Elasticity in Decision Making
summary: The article discusses how product life cycle management affects demand and how small companies can adapt to changing market conditions. It suggests that a company facing declining demand for its products can diversify its product line by adding new features or fragrances while maintaining the same price. Alternatively, they can explore new markets for their existing products, like industrial uses, where price sensitivity may be lower.

title: Managing the product and the process record: Benefits of using product life cycle
summary: This article highlights the benefits of integrating product lifecycle management (PLM) systems with manufacturing process management (MPM) to streamline product development and reduce manufacturing costs. By linking engineering data, BOM routing, and assembly instructions within PLM, companies can eliminate paper-based processes, improve data accuracy, and enhance collaboration among internal and external stakeholders. The result is a more efficient and cost-effective manufacturing process, leading to faster product releases and reduced waste.
